publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1852 Tricia Marwick: Jim Baxter—That the Parliament regrets the recent death of Jim Baxter; offers sympathy to his relatives and friends on their loss, and urges the Scottish Football Association, in recognition of Jim Baxter's unique talent and his unforgettable contribution to Scottish football, to include him in Scotland's Football Hall of Fame. Supported by: Phil Gallie*, Andrew Wilson*, Roseanna Cunningham*
S1M-1852 Jim Baxter (lodged on 23 April 2001) Bruce Crawford*, Shona Robison*, Michael Russell*, Maureen Macmillan*, Michael Matheson*, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*
S1M-1852 Jim Baxter (lodged on 23 April 2001) Dr Winnie Ewing*, Mr Brian Monteith*
S1M-1852 Jim Baxter (lodged on 23 April 2001) Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Mr Alex Salmond*, Mr John McAllion*, Trish Godman*, Fiona McLeod*

S1M-1852 Tricia Marwick: Jim Baxter—That the Parliament regrets the recent death of Jim Baxter; offers sympathy to his relatives and friends on their loss, and urges the Scottish Football Association, in recognition of Jim Baxter's unique talent and his unforgettable contribution to Scottish football, to include him in Scotland's Football Hall of Fame. Supported by: Phil Gallie, Andrew Wilson, Roseanna Cunningham, Bruce Crawford, Shona Robison, Michael Russell, Maureen Macmillan, Michael Matheson, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Dr Winnie Ewing, Mr Brian Monteith, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Alex Salmond, Mr John McAllion, Trish Godman, Fiona McLeod
S1M-1852 Jim Baxter (lodged on 23 April 2001) Bristow Muldoon*, Brian Adam*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*
S1M-1852 Jim Baxter (lodged on 23 April 2001) David McLetchie*, Dennis Canavan*

S1M-1852 Tricia Marwick: Jim Baxter—That the Parliament regrets the recent death of Jim Baxter; offers sympathy to his relatives and friends on their loss, and urges the Scottish Football Association, in recognition of Jim Baxter's unique talent and his unforgettable contribution to Scottish football, to include him in Scotland's Football Hall of Fame. Supported by: Phil Gallie, Andrew Wilson, Roseanna Cunningham, Bruce Crawford, Shona Robison, Michael Russell, Maureen Macmillan, Michael Matheson, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Dr Winnie Ewing, Mr Brian Monteith, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Alex Salmond, Mr John McAllion, Trish Godman, Fiona McLeod, Bristow Muldoon, Brian Adam, Mr Kenny MacAskill, David McLetchie, Dennis Canavan
